results.title: Warming by the devil's fire
results.creator_credit: Charles Burnett, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Blues Collection = Martin Scorsese presents The Blues a musical journey [DVD]”.
Part of Martin Scorsese’s “The Blues Collection”. Kidnapped by Uncle Buddy, on his way to be saved from the devil by being baptised, a young 11 year-old boy gets a life education on exactly what it is he is going to be ‘saved’ from. Through a re-telling of this young boy’s journey travelling the Deep South, his education becomes the viewers’ with a narration (by Carl Lumbly) of the boy as an adult recalling this past he will never forget. The history of the African American musician is his lesson, starting out in New Orleans and the blues music that stemmed from early 1900 to the 1940s turns into, as the director says, a ‘story that gives you the impression of the blues’. Inserted in the ‘educational’ narrative is a combination of archival footage of the period, original performances and stills. The influence of the church and gospel music is covered and the work also includes details of female performers whose powerful music and voices transcend time and place, such as Bessie Smith, Victoria Spivey, Ma Rainey, Dinah Washington and Sister Rosetta Thorpe. Others featured include Willie Dixon, Sonny Boy Williamson, Son House, John Lee Hooker and Muddy Waters amongst many others. Cast includes Tommy Redmond Hicks and Nathaniel Lee Jr. with an original score by Stephen James Taylor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Burnett, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)

results.title: Warm strangers
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Melanie Coombs and Ivan Sen
results.brief_description: At the end of his journey, Jess attempts to reunite with his father whom he has not seen for years. Powerful short from the director of ‘Beneath Clouds’ (2002), Produced by Melanie Coombs (‘Harvey Krumpet’). Original format 16mm/black and white.

results.title: Warm nights on a slow moving train
results.creator_credit: Bob Ellis, Patric Juillet, Ross Dimsey and Western Pacific Films
results.brief_description: Wendy Hughes plays an art teacher employed at a Catholic girls’ convent school from Monday to Friday. At weekends she rides the overnight express train between Sydney and Melbourne as a prostitute in order to keep her addict brother supplied with morphine. Every week she changes her appearance, mannerisms, and personality, luring male clients who always pay and leave by 3 a.m. However, an intelligence agent (Colin Friels) becomes her lover and they team up to murder a politician on the train. Wendy Hughes exudes sensuality, power and passion in the lead role.
results.title_for_label: Warm nights on a slow moving train
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Ellis, Patric Juillet, Ross Dimsey and Western Pacific Films

results.title: Warlords and Widows the Maronites of Lebanon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
This film focuses on the Maronites of Lebanon and is Part Two of a two-part investigation that explores the underlying beliefs, emotions and antagonisms that have resulted in the battles between the Christians and the Islamics of the Middle East.

results.title: WarGames
results.brief_description: David Lightman has a talent for hacking. But while trying to hack into a computer system to play unreleased video games, he unwittingly taps into the Defense Department’s war computer and initiates a confrontation of global proportions!

constellations_other.name: Hack the planet
constellations_other.description: How do you represent something that's... kinda boring to look at, like hacking, when you're operating in a visual medium like film, TV and videogames?

results.description: High School student David Lightman (Matthew Broderick) has a talent for hacking. But while trying to hack into a computer system to play unreleased video games, he unwittingly taps into the Defense Department’s war computer and initiates a confrontation of global proportions! Together with his girlfriend (Ally Sheedy) and a wizardly computer genius (John Wood), David must race against time to outwit his opponent…and prevent a nuclear Armageddon.
description_for_label: High School student David Lightman (Matthew Broderick) has a talent for hacking. But while trying to hack into a computer system to play unreleased video games, he unwittingly taps into the Defense Department’s war computer and initiates a confrontation of global proportions! Together with his girlfriend (Ally Sheedy) and a wizardly computer genius (John Wood), David must race against time to outwit his opponent…and prevent a nuclear Armageddon.

results.title: Wardens of Waterton
results.creator_credit: Leslie McFarlane and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Every summer thousands of visitors come to Waterton Lakes National Park to enjoy its mountain grandeur, fishing, swimming, and all the other attractions that make for summer enjoyment. To show how this heritage of beauty and pleasure is preserved year after year, the film takes us on a tour of large-scale outdoor housekeeping. We see not only how wardens organise and administer the Park’s services, but also how they protect wildlife and co-operate with their partners across the border, the rangers of Montana’s Glacier Park.

results.title: Warcraft
results.headline_credit: Canada, China, Japan and United States of America, 2016
results.brief_description: The realm of Azeroth stands on the brink of war as its civilization faces a fearsome race of invading orcs fleeing their dying home to colonize another. As a portal opens to connect the two worlds, one army faces destruction and the other faces extinction.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

results.headline_credit_for_label: Canada, China, Japan and United States of America, 2016
results.description: The peaceful realm of Azeroth stands on the brink of war as its civilization faces a fearsome race of invaders: orc warriors fleeing their dying home to colonize another. As a portal opens to connect the two worlds, one army faces destruction and the other faces extinction. From opposing sides, two heroes are set on a collision course that will decide the fate of their family, their people, and their home.
description_for_label: The peaceful realm of Azeroth stands on the brink of war as its civilization faces a fearsome race of invaders: orc warriors fleeing their dying home to colonize another. As a portal opens to connect the two worlds, one army faces destruction and the other faces extinction. From opposing sides, two heroes are set on a collision course that will decide the fate of their family, their people, and their home.

results.title: War, tears and memories
results.creator_credit: Jean Parry and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Jean’s greatest memory was the Battle of Alemein. She remembers the noise and the booming of the guns and the flood of patients needing attention. Serving as a army nurse during World War II, Jean recalls some of her most memorable times during the war, as well as her life in Melbourne, growing up with four brothers in Oakleigh and how 17 members of her family attended the Anzac Day march in 2009.

results.title: War, man's destiny
results.brief_description:
Combines art work, original drawings, and excerpts from classical European paintings in an animated film which recreates the blood contests between the French and Russians in the Napoleonic Wars, and which deplores the horror of war in all times and places. Set with music from Tchaikovsky’s 1812 Overture.
(Awards: Special Jury Prize, Cannes, 1973)
